description.narrative: IFC is proposing to invest up to US$100 million, including: 1) up to US$[60] million C loan (Tranche 1), and 2) a potential up to US$[40] million quasi-equity or equity (Tranche 2) to ALBA Group Asia Ltd. (ALBA Group Asia Ltd. and Dugong Ltd., collectively is referred to ALBA Asia or the Company). The Tranche 1 is to support the companys development, investment and management of additional hazardous waste (HW) treatment and biowaste (BW) treatment projects in China (the Project). The Company is a regional platform established by the shareholders of ALBA Group (the Sponsor, or ALBA Group), a privately-owned global leading waste management and recycling group originated in Germany, to invest several selected high-potential waste management segments, including hazardous waste, bio waste, plastic recycling, and smart city solutions in Asia.

The Project supports the development of hazardous waste treatment and bio waste management facilities in China, mostly in frontier regions, to help address inadequate waste management services. The main project level effect is on stakeholders through the increase in scientific treatment capacity for hazardous waste and bio waste. The Project will benefit local populations and industries by introducing advanced waste treatment and management methods that are expected to reduce safety and health risks, improve environmental conditions, and contribute to the avoidance of GHG emissions. Beyond the Project, the investment contributes to market sustainability by demonstrating the adoption and implementation of recent regulations for the treatment of hazardous waste aligned to international standards.
